reviews.text: This hotel made me realize that a good hotel is not all about 5-star facilities or grand buildings, it's about the people, the way they make you feel so warm and pampered, and their thoughtfulness & efforts to pamper the guests down to the smallest details. The services provided showed that the guests' comfort is their best interest. The staffs, from the receptionist down to the gardeners, pool staff etc, is always friendly and polite, their sincere smiles tells us that even they, are very happy to be working in such a nice, beautiful and cozy place. Ironically, this holiday get away makes us feel that the home is where the heart is...casa del mar ^_^

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a junior suite at the Casa del Mar after reading rave reviews in Trip Advisor. We knew fully well that it was a small hotel but had loads of character and great service. Having been there for almost a week we can vouch for the fact these are all true. The junior suite was very spacious and had several facilities thrown in. Of the two balconies, one had great views of the ocean and the beach and was big enough to have two deck chairs and a hammock. The pool was smallish but clean. The staff are engaged and friendly and were willing to help with suggestions on local attractions. Casa del Mar has some great partnerships with different groups providing sight-seeing and adventure trips. One tour that visitors shouldn't miss is the mangrove tour. Aida our guide from Dev's Adventures on this tour was a storehouse of information and went out of her way to make us comfortable. Also, a trip to the famed cable car and the bridge is worth it. Several restaurants dot the street just outside the hotel and the food is reasonably priced and of a pretty high quality. The food at Casa del Mar is good as well and the breakfast is substantial and diverse. Overall, a great stay and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Will go back for sure.
reviews.title: Great little hotel by the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, great staff. Stayed for 3 nights - most relaxing nights of our trip around borneo and malaysia. Food in the restaurant was wonderful and it was great to sit having dinner on the beach. Afternoon tea was pretty great too. Rooms are spacious and well decorated and great to relax in if its raining outside. The spa was also brilliant - I tried one of the other spas across the road from this hotel too - but it just didn't compare. Although the hotel was a little more pricey than we were going for it was definately worth the extra cash. Langkawi is beautiful and I would recommed this hotel to discover it
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Casa del Mar with some friends in March 2009. The goal for traveling to Malaysia was to get away from the winter in Norway, relax and enjoy good food and summer. We really enjoyed our stay from the first second we arrived the hotel. The staff is very helpful, sweet and service minded. Casa del Mar is located on the best part of the beach and have fantastic sun loungers. The rooms are nice and clean. All food served at Casa del Mar from breakfast, lunch to dinner is fantastic, though lunch and dinners is a little more expencive than on others restaurants on the beach and in the neighbourhood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here five nights with my 8 year old daughter, and the experience was wonderful. Lovely, clean rooms (we were upgraded), and warm, attentive service from friendly staff without being intrusive. The hotel has only 30-something rooms (so book well ahead), but it is not so small that there is a lack of privacy. The amenities are superb: a gorgeous pool, small but nicely decked out spa, fabulous restaurant, and a well-stocked library area that is a nice haven. The little touches by the pool were lovely: cold towels, fruit plates, little ice creams. The beach is steps from the hotel and is cleaned every morning. Other people have noted the water was not the turquoise one finds in Thailand, but it was clear despite quite windy weather, warm and swimmable. The hotel staff are knowledgeable and will arrange or provide guidance on any trip or activity, with the minimum of hassle. It's true that if you walk out the street side, you are taken to "main street" Pantai Cenang with various touristy shops and stalls, but there's also plenty of interesting local restaurants (recommend The Padi Cafe, next to the paddy fields across the road from Casa del Mar; the Indian-British chef from Wales cooks amazing chilli and curry dishes, and is equally skilled at western food). All part of the Langkawi experience. Last but not least - the hotel GM's wife is a designer and will create a made-to-measure dress for you in a day or so, using beautiful fabrics she buys from around Bali. We will definitely return to Casa del Mar in the not too distant future.
reviews.title: A tranquil escape with thoughtful attention and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a naturally restless person whose idea of a perfect holiday does not usually include spending almost two weeks on a beach, but I was genuinely sad to leave this place. It seems to have that rare combination of location, quality and welcome which most hotels find elusive; indeed, I have only encountered it once before in many years of travel. The result of this indefinable ambience was that we only ventured outside its environs (other than walking to local restaurants) for one day, when we hired a car.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel in the perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the food is excellent at CASA DEL MAR, it really is worthwhile (and important for the local economy) to sample the local fare. LAMAN PADI (directly opposite the hotel) has two excellent restaurants); ORKID RIA has great seafood; CHAMPOR CHAMPOR is eccentric with rushed service but an interesting menu; and there are others whose names I have already forgotten. - we didn't have a single negative experience.
reviews.title: Somewhere where you will never forget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for a laid-back, quiet and informal atmosphere, attentive and intuitive staff with friendly and effective management, superb beach location, and 4* quality (5*, if you use my personal rating system). If you want a sterile, frosty, isolated, elitist resort hotel which is only interested in your money, then I believe that some such places exist on the north of the island (and certainly exist elsewhere) - but if you want to feel completely at home while being cosseted in a quality establishment within which you can attain a degree of relaxation you thought impossible, stay at the CASA DEL MAR.
reviews.title: Wonderful holiday at the Casa del Mar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the casa for five wonderful nights in july. From the moment we walked into the lobby we were made to feel at home, we were personally welcomed and showed around the hotel and to our room. We had a poolview room and it was lovely, with lovely touches to make the stay a special one. I would recommend the spa, where we both had a full body massage and facial and it was amazing, the spa staff are charming and very good at their job. We also went on the castaway picnic which was great fun, you are brought to a fresh water lake first and their are loads of monkeys their so we got great photos. Then we were brought to the island where our tent was set up with a picnic and it was very romantic. Our boat driver was a lovely guy, he even waved us goodbye the day we checked out. The pool was lovely and the sunbeds were so comfy, the beach was kept lovely and clean as was the pool area. Beakfast was great, lunch was great and we had dinner one night and it was very good quality food, I would recommend the fillet beef!! We also went to Bonton restaurant and it was beautiful. there is also a great chinese seafood restaurant down the road, it was very busy, a good sign, and the food was very tasty. We had two stormy days, which we spent at the waterworld, its worth a trip if the weather is bad, beautiful seals and penguins there. I didnt find the duty free much good, some things were good value but I found most things to be the same price. We absolutely loved langkawi, its not over developed or too touristy which is great and the people are so friendly and lovely. The Casa Del Mar is a great place to stay, its intimate, quiet and you really feel spoiled during your stay. Theres also free internet access which is brilliuant for keeping in touch with home. Thanks to all the lovely staff at the Casa, ye are doing a great job, keep it up!
reviews.title: An unforgettable tropical storm!

aka: Casa Del Mar Langkawi Hotel Pantai Cenang
description: The heart of Casa del Mar's (Spanish for ‘Home by the sea’) philosophy is to create unique experiences around individual guests, providing them with a tranquil hideaway. Offering sea view accommodation, innovative dining options and Spa facilities, the 34-room Casa del Mar is the perfect oasis for couples looking for a private and peaceful retreat. From its Mediterranean architecture to its cosy and aesthetically pleasing interior, Casa del Mar is a ‘highly individualised property’. At Casa del Mar, one can indulge in the personalised yet unobtrusive service designed specially to pamper the individual. Guests will be in for a real gastronomic experience with La Sal Restaurant where innovative & yet soul satisfying Mediterranean cuisine, seafood BBQ and Asian samplers will be served. Guests can choose to sit inside the restaurant, with interiors recreated to the splendour of a Californian winery or dine al fresco at the poolside or beachside. Casa del Mar offers one the tranquility of a private holiday home by day and subtle gaiety by night through entertainment and dining options. All traditional hospitality practices will be challenged such that every aspect of the property is in harmony with the objective of creating experiences around individuals. Please note that we specialise in couples and adults and do not offer cots or extra beds in guest rooms. Location: Located at the legendary island of Langkawi, northwest of Peninsula Malaysia, Casa del Mar sits along the island’s Pantai Cenang beach, which is a 10-minute ride from the Langkawi airport and within close proximity to Kuah town, the most popular entertainment area in Langkawi with a wide selection of restaurants and bars.
